Commenter: Ethics and Public Policy Center (Jamie Bryan Hall and Ryan T. Anderson)
Information Requested:
The FDA should reinstate earlier, stronger patient safety protocols for mifepristone, including:
  1. Requiring at least three in-person office visits by the patient
  2. Prescribing mifepristone only by physicians who have read and understood the prescribing information
  3. Administering mifepristone only in a clinic, medical office, or hospital, under the supervision of a physician
  4. Requiring healthcare providers to report all serious adverse events resulting from the use of mifepristone
  5. Prescribing mifepristone only to women who are confirmed by a physician to be in the first seven weeks of pregnancy
